title: Why we’re taking legal action against SerpApi’s unlawful scraping
author: Halimah DeLaine Prado
description: We filed a suit today against the scraping company SerpApi.
summary: Google has filed a lawsuit against Bright Data and its subsidiary SerpApi, alleging that their unauthorized and extensive scraping of Google Search results violates Google's terms of service. Google asserts this activity negatively impacts user experience, intellectual property, and security, consuming significant resources to counteract, while Bright Data defends its services as facilitating access to public web data for various legitimate uses.

title: 40 of our most helpful AI tips from 2025
author: Molly McHugh-Johnson
description: Learn more about the AI tips and tools Google shared in 2025.
summary: Google highlights three key AI user profiles emerging in 2025: the "Prompt Engineer," the "AI Collaborator," and the "AI Explorer," emphasizing effective strategies like detailed prompting for better outcomes, leveraging AI for creative brainstorming and summarization, and using multimodal capabilities. The article suggests that tools like Gemini are becoming essential for enhancing productivity and creativity across various tasks.

title: 5 ways AI agents will transform the way we work in 2026
author: Anil Jain
description: Today, Google Cloud dropped its 2026 AI Agent Trends Report.
summary: Google Cloud's AI Business Trends Report 2026 reveals that 72% of surveyed executives plan to increase AI spending in the next year, with a significant focus on integrating AI for operational efficiency and innovative solutions. The report identifies key trends such as the emergence of specialized AI roles, the importance of robust AI governance, and a projected $10 trillion global economic impact by 2030, underscoring AI's transformative potential across industries.

title: Organize your insights with Data Tables in NotebookLM.
description: Valuable information is rarely neat. Key facts are often scattered, making manual compilation tedious.Today, we’re making that simpler with Data Tables. NotebookLM now s…
summary: NotebookLM has been enhanced with new capabilities, allowing users to upload and interact with data from Google Sheets, CSVs, and Google Docs directly within the tool. Users can now leverage natural language prompts to analyze data, generate summaries, and create new tables or charts, significantly streamlining research and information processing workflows.

title: T5Gemma 2: The next generation of encoder-decoder models
author: Ben Hora
description: T5Gemma 2 is the next evolution of our encoder-decoder family based on Gemma 3.
summary: Google has released T5Gemma-2, a new open-source, lightweight large language model built on the Gemma family, designed for efficient text-to-text generation tasks. This model offers enhanced capabilities for summarization, translation, and general text generation, providing developers with a flexible and powerful tool for building AI applications.

title: You can now verify Google AI-generated videos in the Gemini app.
description: We’re expanding our content transparency tools to help you more easily identify AI-generated content. You can now check if a video was edited or created with Google AI d…
summary: Google is rolling out new features within the Gemini app and Google Search to help users verify the authenticity of online videos, particularly those generated by AI. This initiative leverages SynthID to watermark AI-generated videos and provides tools for users to quickly check whether a video has been manipulated or created using AI, aiming to combat misinformation.

title: FunctionGemma: Bringing bespoke function calling to the edge
author: Ravin Kumar
description: FunctionGemma is a specialized version of our Gemma 3 270M model fine-tuned for function calling.
summary: Google has introduced Function Calling capabilities for its Gemma models, enabling developers to integrate large language models with external tools, APIs, and databases. This new feature allows Gemma to perform actions, retrieve real-time information, and execute complex workflows, significantly enhancing its utility for building advanced AI agents and applications.

title: Inside Kaggle's AI Agents intensive course with Google
author: Anant Nawalgaria
description: Kaggle’s AI Agents Intensive with Google brought learners together in a no-cost course to build and deploy the next frontier of AI.
summary: This recap of a Google-led AI Agents Intensive highlights critical aspects of building intelligent AI agents, emphasizing advanced prompt engineering, effective tool use, and thoughtful ethical considerations. Developers learned to leverage models like Gemini and various Google Cloud AI services to create agents capable of complex tasks, from planning to action execution, driving innovation in AI application development.

title: Caring for the Future: a Council of Europe expert reads “The Future Report”
author: Brian O’Neill
description: A Council of Europe expert — and Emeritus Research Fellow at Technological University Dublin — analyzes The Future Report.
summary: This article discusses a Council of Europe's "Future Report" which underscores the critical need for responsible AI development and governance to protect children's rights and well-being in an increasingly technology-driven world. It highlights concerns regarding data privacy, algorithmic bias, and digital literacy, urging a multi-stakeholder approach to ensure a safer and more equitable digital future for younger generations.

title: Watch a podcast discussion about Gemini 3 and the future of Search.
description: Learn how Gemini 3 powers Google Search with Generative UI, Nano Banana, and interactive graphics.
summary: Google is enhancing its podcast search capabilities within Google Search, leveraging AI to deeply understand and index audio content beyond just titles and descriptions. This upgrade allows users to search for specific topics discussed within podcast episodes, delivering more precise results, including relevant transcripts and key moments, significantly improving content discoverability.

title: Gemini 3 Flash: frontier intelligence built for speed
author: Tulsee Doshi
description: Gemini 3 Flash offers frontier intelligence built for speed at a fraction of the cost.
summary: Google has introduced Gemini 1.5 Flash, a new lightweight, multimodal AI model optimized for speed and cost-efficiency, building upon the capabilities of Gemini 1.5 Pro. Designed for high-volume, low-latency applications, Gemini 1.5 Flash excels in tasks such as summarization, chat, and vision-to-language interactions, making it ideal for developers requiring rapid processing and scalability.

title: Build with Gemini 3 Flash, frontier intelligence that scales with you
author: Logan Kilpatrick
description: Gemini 3 Flash is available for developers to build with now. Learn more about this smarter, scale-ready model and how — and where — you can use it now.
summary: This article guides developers on leveraging Google's new Gemini 1.5 Flash, a highly efficient and cost-effective multimodal AI model, to build innovative applications. It emphasizes its utility for tasks like crafting responsive chatbots, generating concise content, and performing rapid data analysis, providing insights into API access and integration for scalable solutions.

title: Build interactive mini apps with Opal in the Gemini app.
author: Megan Li
description: Opal — our tool for building AI-powered mini apps — is now directly available in the Gemini web app as a way to create experimental Gems. You can find it in your Gems ma…
summary: Google Labs is experimenting with "mini apps" within the Gemini app, exemplified by a project called "Opal," designed to streamline specific tasks and workflows. These mini apps leverage AI to integrate with other Google services, allowing users to organize information, summarize content, and enhance productivity directly within the Gemini interface.

title: 8 ways to make the most out of Slide Decks in NotebookLM
author: Usama Bin Shafqat
description: Nano Banana Pro makes NotebookLM ever more powerful to synthesize information and create visual storytelling materials.
summary: Google details eight effective strategies for leveraging NotebookLM to enhance productivity with slide decks, including those from Google Slides or PowerPoint. Users can upload presentations to NotebookLM to automatically summarize content, extract key takeaways, generate Q&A questions, and create comprehensive study guides, transforming static slides into dynamic, interactive learning and analysis tools.

title: Look back at Google Play’s biggest launches for developers in 2025
description: As 2025 comes to an end, we’re revisiting some of the biggest updates and key developments in Google Play this year. It all reflects our commitment to making Google Play…
summary: Google's "Year in Review 2025" for developers highlights significant advancements across AI, cloud computing, and open-source initiatives, focusing on tools and platforms designed to empower innovation. Key milestones include expanded access to advanced models like Gemini, new capabilities within Google Cloud, and continued commitment to developer communities, fostering a dynamic ecosystem for building next-generation applications.

title: Help boost your daily productivity with CC, a new experimental AI agent from Google Labs.
description: CC is our new experimental AI productivity agent from Google Labs, built with Gemini to help you stay organized and get things done. When you sign up, it connects your G…
summary: Google Labs is developing a Cross-Channel (CC) AI Agent designed to act as a "project manager" for complex, multi-application tasks, leveraging multimodal AI to interpret and execute requests across Google Workspace products like Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive, and Calendar. This agent breaks down high-level goals into sub-tasks, performs actions (e.g., drafting emails, populating spreadsheets), and incorporates human feedback to refine its processes for tasks like travel planning or market research. The goal is to make AI agents more helpful by operating across various apps.

title: We’re publishing an AI playbook to help others with sustainability reporting.
author: Luke Elder
description: We’re sharing a practical playbook to help organizations streamline and enhance sustainability reporting with AI.Corporate transparency is essential, but navigating frag…
summary: Google, in collaboration with the World Economic Forum, BCG, and Accenture, launched the AI Playbook for Sustainability Reporting to guide organizations in leveraging AI for enhanced ESG reporting. Unveiled at Davos 2024, the playbook emphasizes responsible AI practices, data privacy, and ethical considerations while detailing how AI can improve data collection, processing, and analysis for more accurate and comprehensive sustainability reports. This initiative aims to help businesses meet increasing demands for transparent sustainability disclosures.

title: You can now have more fluid and expressive conversations when you go Live with Search.
author: Liza Ma
description: When you go Live with Search, you can have a back-and-forth voice conversation in AI Mode to get real-time help and quickly find relevant sites across the web. And now, …
summary: Google Search is rolling out a new Gemini model capability that enables users to engage in more natural, live audio conversations by asking questions vocally and then responding to follow-up prompts or clarifications through spoken dialogue. This update, available on mobile devices, allows Gemini to process information and understand nuances more akin to human interaction, making search queries more dynamic and conversational. It signifies a move towards a more interactive and intuitive search experience.

title: Bringing state-of-the-art Gemini translation capabilities to Google Translate
author: Rose Yao
description: We’re bringing Gemini’s state-of-the-art translation model to Google Translate for text, and more new features.
summary: Google Search is enhancing Gemini's translation capabilities, enabling users to translate text directly by hovering over it, convert entire webpages, and facilitate live audio conversations across multiple languages. This upgrade aims to improve global information accessibility by making multilingual interactions within Search more seamless and comprehensive. The goal is to break down language barriers and provide information to a broader global audience.

title: Gradient Canvas: Celebrating over a decade of artistic collaborations with AI
author: Amit Sood
description: Gradient Canvas is a new art exhibition celebrating a decade of creative collaborations between artists and artificial intelligence.
summary: Google Research has unveiled Gradient Canvas, an innovative AI art tool designed to empower users with more control over the creative process by blending traditional drawing techniques with AI image generation. This tool facilitates iterative image refinement, allowing users to guide the AI at intermediate stages and make AI art creation more accessible and user-controlled. It aims to bridge the gap between human creativity and AI capabilities in visual arts.

title: 4 highlights from Google Beam in 2025
author: Aaron Luber
description: Google Beam, our first true-to-life 3D video communication platform, made great progress in 2025.
summary: Google Research's "Beam" project explores the evolution of "moments" – proactive, personalized, and timely AI-driven information assistance – by 2025, moving beyond conventional search results. This initiative, building on the Search Generative Experience (SGE), anticipates user needs by synthesizing information from diverse sources to provide more integrated and helpful responses. Beam aims to make information not just findable, but anticipatory and deeply contextualized within daily life.

title: Take the web for a fresh spin with GenTabs, built with Gemini 3
author: Amit Pitaru
description: GenTabs is part of a new Google Labs experiment that proactively creates custom web applications to help you navigate the web
summary: Google Labs is piloting GenTabs, an experimental feature for Gemini designed to streamline research by intelligently organizing and summarizing content across open browser tabs using AI. GenTabs identifies related tabs, extracts key information, and provides users with quick contextual overviews, significantly improving information synthesis for complex research tasks. This tool aims to enhance productivity and reduce cognitive load for users managing multiple browser tabs.

title: Build with Gemini Deep Research
author: Shrestha Basu Mallick
description: We have reimagined Gemini Deep Research to be more powerful than ever, now accessible to developers via the new Interactions API.
summary: Google is providing developers access to a deep research agent constructed using the Gemini API, showcasing how advanced AI can conduct complex, multi-step research, synthesize findings, and present comprehensive results. This offering highlights Gemini's extensive capabilities and empowers developers to build sophisticated AI applications for intricate information gathering and analysis. The agent demonstrates the potential for autonomous, high-quality research powered by AI.

title: Interactions API: A unified foundation for models and agents
author: Philipp Schmid
description: Google’s Interactions API is a unified interface for interacting with Gemini models and agents.
summary: Google has launched a new Interactions API aimed at simplifying the development of conversational AI experiences across its diverse product ecosystem, including Search, Assistant, and Android. This API standardizes intent recognition and action execution, providing developers with a unified framework to integrate AI seamlessly into various applications and platforms. The goal is to make it easier for developers to build consistent and intuitive AI interactions for users.

title: 5 tips for peace of mind with your family’s new device this holiday
author: Mindy Brooks
description: Set up your child's new phone or tablet for a safer holiday with these quick tips for Google Family Link.
summary: Google offers essential tips for parents to set up new devices for children during the holidays using Google Family Link, emphasizing digital wellbeing, privacy, and safety. These recommendations cover configuring content filters, establishing screen time limits, managing app permissions, and utilizing location tracking to ensure a safer online experience for kids. The advice helps parents navigate gifting new tech responsibly and securely.

title: These developers are changing lives with Gemma 3n
author: Kristen Quan
description: From enhancing assistive technology to addressing the digital divide, developers built mobile-first solutions to address real-world problems in the Gemma 3n Impact Challenge.
summary: Google is showcasing how developers are leveraging Gemma, its family of open models, to create impactful AI applications that address critical real-world challenges across diverse sectors. These innovative projects span education, accessibility, environmental monitoring, and healthcare, demonstrating the profound societal benefits and versatility of open-source AI technologies. Gemma empowers developers to build responsible AI solutions for a better world.

title: Bring your app ideas to life with Gemini 3 in Stitch.
author: Rustin Banks
description: Starting today, we’re bringing the power of Gemini 3 to Stitch, our experimental AI-powered design tool. Gemini 3 in Stitch will mean higher quality UI generation to hel…
summary: Google Labs is launching Stitch, an experimental Gemini feature designed to enhance browser memory by organizing and contextualizing past web activities, including visited pages and search queries. Stitch aims to help users more effectively recall information and seamlessly resume previous tasks, serving as an intelligent assistant for browser-based productivity and knowledge retention. This tool leverages AI to transform fragmented browser history into a cohesive, searchable memory.

title: The 7 finalists in the XPRIZE Quantum Applications competition
author: Ryan Babbush
description: Google announces the 7 finalists in the XPRIZE Quantum Applications competition.
summary: Google Research and the GESDA XPRIZE have revealed the finalists for their Quantum Applications Challenge, an initiative seeking innovative quantum algorithms to address pressing real-world issues. The challenge spotlights quantum computing's potential to revolutionize sectors such as healthcare, energy, and climate change through advanced computational solutions. These finalists showcase pioneering ideas that could leverage quantum technology for significant global impact.

title: New updates make Jules a proactive AI partner
author: AK Kulkarni
description: We’re evolving Jules to be a more proactive coding agent, where it can operate alongside you.
summary: Jules, an AI agent powered by Google Assistant, is receiving proactive updates that enable it to anticipate user needs and offer assistance without explicit prompts during complex workflows. This enhancement allows Jules to identify opportune moments for intervention, such as during travel planning or subscription management, moving towards a more anticipatory and helpful AI experience. The goal is to make AI assistance more seamless and integrated into daily tasks.

title: Improving Gemini Text-to-Speech models for better control and capabilities
author: Ivan Solovyev
description: New Gemini 2.5 Flash and Gemini 2.5 Pro Text-to-Speech (TTS) preview models bring enhanced style and tone versatility, pacing control, and multi-speaker capabilities.
summary: Google has announced that its Gemini 2.5 models will now incorporate text-to-speech (TTS) capabilities, enabling developers to integrate high-quality, natural-sounding voice generation directly into their applications. This advancement significantly expands the multimodal potential of Gemini, facilitating more interactive and accessible AI experiences. Developers can now use Gemini to create applications that communicate audibly with lifelike voices.

title: Build the internet young people are asking for — instead of simply banning them from it
author: Dr. Jeffrey DeMarco
description: Save the Children looks at “bans” from the perspective of those who would be most affected: young people themselves.
summary: This article advocates for a proactive approach to youth internet safety, urging against outright bans and instead promoting the creation of a safer, more enriching online environment tailored to young people's needs. It highlights the importance of digital literacy, education, and collaborative efforts among tech companies, parents, and educators, while also mentioning Google Family Link as a supportive tool. The piece emphasizes building an internet that empowers, rather than restricts, young users.

title: Learn more about AI in the workplace in our new research report.
description: A new global survey of executives, decision makers and knowledge workers reveals that organizations truly transforming with AI are seeing real results that move their bu…
summary: Google's research report reveals the significant positive impact of AI, particularly Gemini, on workplace productivity, creativity, and task automation, based on surveys across various professional settings. The findings indicate a strong positive sentiment among workers regarding AI tools, suggesting that integrating AI can streamline operations and foster innovation in professional environments. The report highlights AI's role in shifting work towards more strategic and creative endeavors.

title: 2025 at Google
description: Learn more about Google’s launches, milestones and more from 2025.
summary: This article offers a retrospective from 2025, envisioning AI as seamlessly integrated into daily life, proactively anticipating needs and providing assistance across numerous domains. It highlights AI's transformative impact on personalized learning, healthcare, and environmental solutions, reflecting on the rapid advancements and pervasive influence of artificial intelligence. The piece paints a picture of AI as an intuitive partner that enhances human capabilities and quality of life.

title: The Android Show: New features for Galaxy XR and a look at future devices
author: Shahram Izadi
description: We’re releasing new updates for the Galaxy XR headset starting today, and announcing updates for Android XR.
summary: The Android Show XR Edition unveiled significant updates focusing on innovations in extended reality (XR) for the Android ecosystem, highlighting advancements in spatial computing and immersive experiences. These updates also include new developer tools designed to facilitate the creation of XR applications on Android devices, pushing the boundaries of interactive digital environments. The announcements signal Google's commitment to evolving Android into a robust platform for future XR technologies.

title: Create presentations with Nano Banana Pro in Mixboard and more
author: Jaclyn Konzelmann
description: Learn more about recent updates to Google Labs’ Mixboard, like presentations, doodling and Nano Banana Pro.
summary: Google Labs has launched "Nano Banana Pro" within Mixboard, a multimodal AI tool powered by Gemini that simplifies content creation, particularly presentations, by synthesizing information from diverse sources like text, images, and video. This tool leverages Gemini's advanced multimodal capabilities to analyze disparate data and generate structured, coherent outputs, automating complex content generation tasks. Mixboard aims to revolutionize how users create and organize information for various purposes.

title: Deepening our AI research partnership with Tel Aviv University
author: Avinatan Hassidim
summary: Google.org is investing in a new AI research lab at Tel Aviv University, led by Prof. Moshiko Ravid, to advance Responsible AI and computational social science. This initiative expands on a 2019 collaboration aimed at fostering AI innovation and talent development within Israel's academic sector. The lab will focus on interdisciplinary research for real-world impact, addressing challenges related to AI safety and ethics.

title: Here’s how researchers in Asia-Pacific are using AlphaFold
author: Rachel Teo
description: Learn more about AlphaFold, Google’s AI system that accurately predicts protein structures.
summary: Google DeepMind's AlphaFold AI system has significantly impacted research across the Asia Pacific over five years, enabling scientists to predict protein structures for advancements in fields like malaria, drug discovery, and cancer treatment. Researchers from institutions such as Osaka University and the Indian Institute of Science have utilized AlphaFold for diverse applications, including developing new anti-malaria drugs and understanding antibiotic resistance. This widespread adoption highlights AlphaFold's role as a publicly available tool for global scientific progress.

title: Get an in-depth look at Gemini 3 with CEO Sundar Pichai.
description: Sundar Pichai sits down with Logan Kilpatrick to discuss Gemini 3 on the Google AI: Release Notes podcast.
summary: Sundar Pichai, Google's CEO, discussed the rapid evolution of AI and Google's approach to its development on an 'AI Release Notes' podcast, highlighting new models like Gemini 1.5 Pro. He emphasized Google's commitment to responsible AI deployment across products such as Search, and detailed how AI is fundamentally changing Google's work and enabling new user experiences. The discussion underscored the foundational impact of multimodal AI and the importance of open-sourcing models for broader innovation.

title: The Google guide for holiday help
description: Learn more about using Google products like Gemini, Search, Shopping, Pixel and more over the holidays.
summary: Google's AI assistant, Gemini, offers comprehensive support for holiday planning, from generating gift ideas and travel itineraries to crafting meal plans and festive recipes. Users can leverage Gemini to streamline tasks such as finding unique experiences, organizing grocery lists, and even sharing ideas with friends via Google Chat. The integration of Gemini across various Google products enhances its utility for a seamless and stress-free holiday season.

title: 4 ways to refine your content in Flow
author: Anika Ahluwalia
description: You’ll now get more creative control in Flow with new refinement and editing capabilities.
summary: Google Labs has unveiled 'Flow & Refine,' a new research project in generative AI designed to provide users with real-time, iterative control over video creation. This innovative system allows for immediate adjustments to video content as it's being generated, offering unprecedented flexibility and precision in creative workflows. 'Flow & Refine' aims to transform video production by making advanced AI generation tools more accessible and responsive to user input.

title: 3 things to know about Ironwood, our latest TPU
author: Ari Marini
description: Google’s seventh-gen Tensor Processing Unit is here! Learn what makes Ironwood our most powerful and energy-efficient custom silicon to date.
summary: Google Cloud has launched Ironwood, its latest Tensor Processing Unit (TPU), specifically designed to accelerate AI model training and inference with enhanced performance and efficiency. Ironwood TPUs are engineered for demanding generative AI workloads and large language models, providing up to twice the performance per dollar compared to previous generations. This new infrastructure aims to reduce training times and operational costs, making advanced AI capabilities more accessible for developers and enterprises on Google Cloud.

title: Watch ‘The Thinking Game,’ a documentary about Google DeepMind, for free on YouTube.
description: We’re bringing “The Thinking Game" to the Google DeepMind YouTube channel.
summary: Google DeepMind's AlphaZero, an AI system, has developed a 'thinking process' that allows it to master complex games like chess, Go, and shogi without human input, learning solely through self-play. This breakthrough demonstrates how AI can achieve superhuman performance by optimizing its decision-making based on deep search and evaluation, rather than brute force. AlphaZero's method of combining reinforcement learning with deep neural networks has broad implications for AI reasoning and problem-solving beyond games.

title: Google’s AI Futures Fund and Accel Atoms are launching a program to accelerate AI innovation in India.
summary: Google Labs has partnered with Accel to launch the 'AI Futures Fund,' a new initiative designed to support early-stage startups that are building with Google's AI models and infrastructure. This fund will provide capital, mentorship, and access to Google's cutting-edge AI technologies, including Gemini and Imagen, to accelerate innovation in the generative AI space. The collaboration aims to foster a robust ecosystem of AI-powered applications and services, leveraging Google Cloud's capabilities.

title: 16 Google AI tips for stress-free holiday hosting in 2025
author: Molly McHugh-Johnson
description: Use Gemini, Search, Pixel and more to make holiday planning feel effortless in 2025.
summary: Google's Pixel phones and AI features offer seamless solutions for holiday hosting, allowing users to capture perfect moments with tools like Best Take, Magic Editor, and Photo Unblur. Gemini can assist with planning, generating recipes, or crafting festive playlists, while Google Photos provides easy sharing and organization of cherished memories. These integrated Google services and Pixel capabilities aim to simplify event planning and enhance the holiday experience.

title: Develop a deeper understanding with interactive images in Gemini.
author: Dave Messer
summary: Gemini has introduced a new feature that allows users to interact with and ask questions about images they upload, transforming visual content into an interactive learning experience. This capability enables users to identify objects, solve problems, and gain deeper insights directly from images, making it a valuable tool for education and exploration. The interactive image functionality enhances Gemini's multimodal understanding, providing a more engaging way to process and learn from visual information.

title: How we’re bringing AI image verification to the Gemini app
author: Laurie Richardson
description: Our new Gemini app feature allows you to verify Google AI images and determine whether content was created or edited by AI.
summary: The Gemini app is introducing an AI-powered image verification feature to help users identify potentially manipulated or AI-generated images, enhancing media literacy and combating misinformation. This tool leverages Google Search to provide contextual information and verify image authenticity, empowering users to make more informed judgments about the content they encounter. Google's initiative aims to provide transparency and build trust in the digital age, especially amidst the rise of generative AI.

title: Build with Nano Banana Pro, our Gemini 3 Pro Image model
author: Naina Raisinghani
description: Nano Banana Pro, or Gemini 3 Pro Image, is our most advanced image generation and editing model.
summary: Gemini 1.5 Pro is now available for developers via Google AI Studio and Vertex AI, offering enhanced visual understanding capabilities for analyzing images, videos, and audio. This advanced multimodal model supports a massive 1-million-token context window, enabling developers to process and reason over extensive data inputs. The expanded access empowers developers to build sophisticated AI applications that deeply understand and interact with complex visual and auditory information.

title: Introducing Nano Banana Pro
author: Naina Raisinghani
description: Nano Banana Pro is our new image generation and editing model from Google DeepMind.
summary: Google's Gemini Nano, a highly efficient on-device AI model, is expanding to the Pixel 8a and other Android devices, enhancing features like summarization in Recorder and Smart Reply. This rollout brings powerful generative AI capabilities directly to smartphones, allowing for faster and more private processing of tasks without relying solely on cloud connectivity. Additionally, Gemini 1.5 Pro is being integrated into various Google products and services for more complex AI-driven functionalities.

title: How Westinghouse is reenergizing nuclear power with — and for — AI
author: Matt A.V. Chaban
description: Westinghouse has partnered with Google Cloud to develop a custom AI-powered platform.
summary: Westinghouse Electric Company has selected Google Cloud to modernize its global operations, leveraging its robust infrastructure, AI/ML capabilities, and Google Workspace for enhanced collaboration and data analytics. This digital transformation aims to optimize Westinghouse's nuclear power plant design and engineering processes, improve supply chain management, and foster greater efficiency across its workforce. The partnership underscores Google Cloud's role in enabling critical infrastructure sectors with advanced cloud solutions.

title: At our Research@ Poland event we shared how AI is helping us solve big challenges.
description: From AI education to disaster response, see how collaboration is at the heart of the work at Google Research.
summary: Google is strengthening its collaboration with Polish institutions, including the National Information Processing Institute (OPI) and Poznań Supercomputing and Networking Center (PSNC), to establish an AI Research Center in Poland by 2025. This initiative aims to foster advanced AI research, talent development, and accelerate scientific discovery within the region. The center will focus on leveraging AI to address complex challenges across various scientific domains, aligning with Google's global AI research efforts.

title: A conversation on smarter and safer age assurance for Europe
author: Annette Kroeber-Riel
description: Google outlines a risk-based approach to age verification that protects teens online without sacrificing privacy or access for everyone.
summary: Google is enhancing its approach to online age verification to better protect minors across its platforms, implementing measures that balance safety with privacy. This involves working with regulators, using AI, and developing privacy-preserving technologies to determine user age and provide age-appropriate content experiences. YouTube, for example, already employs age restrictions for certain content, demonstrating Google's commitment to creating safer online environments for younger users.

title: Google DeepMind is opening a new AI research lab in Singapore to advance AI in Asia Pacific.
summary: Google DeepMind is opening a new AI research lab in Singapore, led by renowned AI researcher Prof. Hui Xiong, to advance foundational AI research and talent development across the Asia Pacific region. This lab will focus on contributing to Google DeepMind's global mission while addressing local challenges and fostering a vibrant AI ecosystem in Singapore. The initiative underscores Google's commitment to expanding its global AI footprint and collaborating with regional academic and research communities.

title: Start building with Gemini 3
author: Logan Kilpatrick
description: Gemini 3 is introducing advanced agentic coding capabilities, plus Google Antigravity, a new agentic development platform.
summary: Google is making Gemini 1.5 Pro, its most capable model, available to developers globally through Google AI Studio and Vertex AI, featuring a groundbreaking 1-million-token context window and multimodal capabilities. The model, now priced for 128K and 1M context windows, introduces powerful “Function Calling” for connecting to external services and new safety controls to build responsible AI applications. Developers can also fine-tune Gemma family open models on Vertex AI and access advanced features like “controlled generation” for structured output.

title: Google Search with Gemini 3: Our most intelligent search yet
author: Elizabeth Hamon Reid
description: Learn more about Gemini 3 and how it’s upgrading Google Search and AI Mode.
summary: Google is integrating Gemini into Search with new AI Overviews, starting in the U.S., offering multimodal search capabilities that allow users to ask complex questions, including those with videos or photos. This evolution of the Search Generative Experience (SGE) can summarize information, provide planning capabilities for multi-step tasks like meal planning or travel itineraries, and enable users to directly query with a photo taken on their phone. These features are designed to make Google Search more natural and intuitive, offering deeper insights and quicker answers to intricate queries.

title: A new era of intelligence with Gemini 3
author: Koray Kavukcuoglu
description: Today we’re releasing Gemini 3 – our most intelligent model that helps you bring any idea to life.
summary: Google announced Gemini 1.5 Pro, its next-generation multimodal AI model, featuring a 1-million-token context window capable of processing immense amounts of data, including entire books or hour-long videos. This model demonstrates significantly improved performance on benchmarks like MMLU and MMMU, while also maintaining robust safety and responsibility features. Gemini Advanced users can now access a 1-million-token context window in private preview, with plans for a 2-million-token experimental window and future integration with Project Astra, an advanced AI agent initiative.

title: Investing in America 2025
description: Google’s deep investments in American technical infrastructure, R&D and the workforce will help the U.S. continue to lead the world in AI.
summary: Google plans to invest $11.5 billion in the U.S. in 2025, primarily expanding data centers and office campuses across states like Nebraska, Ohio, Pennsylvania, California, and Texas, to support its AI infrastructure and cloud services. This investment will create over 20,000 jobs, including 5,200 full-time Google jobs and 15,000 jobs in local communities, contributing significantly to local economies.

title: 3 lessons from Flow Sessions Artists on AI and creativity
author: Brianna Doyle
description: Learn more about Google’s Flow Sessions, an artist cohort focusing on using AI in film while also using Google’s AI filmmaking tool, Flow.
summary: Google Labs' "Flow Sessions" revealed three key insights into human-AI collaboration: users treat AI as a thought partner, engaging in iterative prompt refinement; they prefer AI to present options rather than definitive answers; and the creative process with AI is non-linear and emergent. These findings, stemming from user interactions with tools like NotebookLM and Gemini, highlight the need for AI interfaces to support dynamic, exploratory workflows.

title: New ways to plan travel with AI in Search
author: Julie Farago
description: Use new Google AI tools to get help with itineraries, finding flight deals and booking reservations.
summary: Google is rolling out new AI-powered planning and creative tools, including "agentic plans" in Search for complex, multi-step tasks like travel booking and trip planning, allowing users to customize and compare options. Additionally, "Canvas AI mode" in Google Photos enables users to leverage generative AI for image editing and creative projects directly within the app, simplifying complex visual tasks.

title: WeatherNext 2: Our most advanced weather forecasting model
author: The WeatherNext team
description: The new AI model delivers more efficient, more accurate and higher-resolution global weather predictions.
summary: Google DeepMind's WeatherNext leverages AI, specifically its GraphCast model, to significantly enhance weather forecasting accuracy and speed globally. GraphCast, which predicts weather up to 10 days in advance, has been demonstrated to outperform traditional numerical weather prediction systems like the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF) on over 90% of key metrics, providing critical support for disaster preparedness and climate research.

title: Google is committing $2.25 million to support AI-ready data in Africa.
description: New funding from Google will help launch a regional Data Commons for Africa.
summary: Google is investing in Africa's AI ecosystem through new initiatives focused on creating high-quality, AI-ready datasets and fostering local talent, critical for developing relevant AI applications. This includes providing grants to African research institutions, collaborating with organizations like DataKind for data annotation, and launching training programs like the AI for Africa initiative to enhance digital literacy and build local AI capacity.

title: Gen AI is bringing New Yorkers' imagination to life
author: Matthieu Kim Lorrain
description: ‘Imagine If…’ lets New Yorkers submit artistic visions of New York City and see them brought to life my local artists.
summary: Google DeepMind's "Imagine If" initiative aims to foster responsible AI development by engaging diverse voices in scenario planning and ethical considerations for advanced AI systems. This program brings together experts from policy, academia, industry, and civil society to explore potential societal impacts and develop frameworks for safely deploying future AI technologies.

title: NotebookLM adds Deep Research and support for more source types
author: Shan Wang
description: NotebookLM adds "Deep Research" for discovering sources, support for Word and PDFs, and a preview of Sheets.
summary: NotebookLM is significantly expanding its content ingestion capabilities, allowing users to upload and analyze a wider range of source materials including Google Docs, Google Slides, PDFs, and URLs, in addition to Google Keep notes. This update enables researchers to conduct deeper, more comprehensive analysis by creating AI-powered summaries, generating questions, and brainstorming across diverse document types.

title: The road to useful quantum computing applications
author: Ryan Babbush
description: An overview of our new framework to help us navigate the pathways and obstacles on the journey to real world quantum computing applications.
summary: Google Research highlights practical applications for quantum computing beyond theoretical benchmarks, focusing on its potential to revolutionize fields like chemistry, materials science, and optimization problems. They emphasize ongoing efforts to develop quantum algorithms that could accelerate drug discovery, create novel materials, and enhance complex logistics, underscoring the shift towards identifying "useful" quantum computing solutions.

title: Google Pixel and Golden Goose partner to  bring AI to global ateliers
author: Google Italy Team
summary: Google Pixel is partnering with luxury fashion brand Golden Goose to integrate AI-powered tools into global ateliers, aiming to enhance creative design and personalize customer experiences. This collaboration will leverage Google's AI capabilities on Pixel devices to assist artisans in ideating, sketching, and customizing products, bridging cutting-edge technology with traditional craftsmanship.

title: Private AI Compute: our next step in building private and helpful AI
author: Jay Yagnik
description: Introducing Private AI Compute, our new way to bring you helpful AI with the power of the cloud, while keeping your data private to you.
summary: Google Private AI Compute introduces a new framework designed to enable AI processing on sensitive data while ensuring robust user privacy through technologies like federated learning and differential privacy. This allows organizations to leverage AI for insights and product improvements without directly accessing raw personal information, addressing critical privacy and security concerns for enterprise and consumer applications.

title: 6 new things you can do with AI in Google Photos
author: Yael Marzan
description: Learn more about new AI tools in Google Photos, including Nano Banana image-generation and more.
summary: Google Photos is rolling out advanced AI features including "Ask Photos," which allows users to find specific photos and memories using natural language queries, and "AI Templates," which provides generative AI-powered tools for creative image editing. These innovations, building on technology like "Nano Banana," aim to make photo organization and enhancement more intuitive and accessible for everyone.

title: Our latest commitments in AI and learning
author: Ben Gomes
description: We’re bringing together experts, students, educators and more at our Google AI for Learning Forum.
summary: Google is reinforcing its commitment to AI education by investing in resources and training programs to help educators and students worldwide understand and responsibly utilize AI. Through initiatives like Google for Education, the company aims to provide accessible learning pathways, develop AI literacy, and equip the next generation with the skills needed for an AI-driven future, emphasizing ethical considerations and practical applications.

title: How AI is giving Northern Ireland teachers time back
author: Lila Ibrahim
description: A six-month long pilot program with the Northern Ireland Education Authority’s C2k initiative found that integrating Gemini and other generative AI tools saved participating teachers an average of 10 hours per week.
summary: Google DeepMind is partnering with schools in Northern Ireland to integrate AI education into their curricula, aiming to foster digital literacy and responsible AI development among students. This initiative, part of a broader effort to equip young people with future-ready skills, focuses on practical AI applications and ethical considerations within the classroom setting.

title: Google is investing in Oklahoma’s workforce and talent pipeline.
description: AI is creating new opportunities for Oklahomans to learn, grow and succeed. Google is committed to making sure the Sooner State is not just ready for this transformation…
summary: Google is expanding its investment in Oklahoma, focusing on workforce development and building a robust talent pipeline through local partnerships and educational programs. This initiative supports the growth of its data center operations in Pryor, Oklahoma, and aims to equip local communities with essential skills for technology jobs, strengthening the state's economic landscape.

title: Opal is now available in more than 160 countries
author: Megan Li
description: We’re bringing Opal to 160 countries.
summary: Google Labs' experimental AI project, Opal, is expanding its availability to over 160 new countries and territories, significantly broadening its reach globally. While specific features are still in development, Opal aims to leverage AI to enhance productivity and organization for a wider user base, reflecting Google's ongoing commitment to bringing cutting-edge AI tools to more people worldwide.

title: Introducing the File Search Tool in Gemini API
author: Animesh Chatterji
description: File Search is a fully managed Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) system built directly into the Gemini API.
summary: Google is enhancing the Gemini API with a new File Search feature, enabling developers to build AI applications that can search and retrieve information across user-provided files within their own services. This integration empowers developers to create more powerful and contextual AI experiences, allowing Gemini models to understand and utilize private, unstructured data sources securely.

title: Create flashcards and quizzes in the NotebookLM app.
description: We’re rolling out a big update to the NotebookLM app this week.
summary: NotebookLM is introducing new AI-powered learning features, including automatic generation of quizzes and flashcards from uploaded source materials, to help users deepen their understanding and retention. These additions transform NotebookLM into a more comprehensive study tool, enabling personalized learning experiences and efficient knowledge consolidation for students and researchers alike.

title: Google Finance adds AI features for research, earnings and more
author: Robert Dunnette
description: Learn more about the new Google Finance, including new features like Deep Search and prediction markets data.
summary: Google Finance is introducing "Deep Search," an AI-powered feature that allows users to conduct highly specific and complex queries for market analysis and investment research. This innovation enables users to explore intricate financial relationships and gain deeper insights into companies, sectors, and economic trends, leveraging Google's advanced AI capabilities for more informed decision-making.

title: AI and learning: A new chapter for students and educators
author: Lila Ibrahim
description: How Google approaches AI and education, from our tools to our commitment to responsibility.
summary: Google outlines its comprehensive vision for integrating AI into learning, aiming to personalize educational experiences, empower teachers with new tools, and develop essential skills for the AI-driven future. The company is investing in research, resources, and partnerships to ensure AI serves as a powerful aid in classrooms, making learning more engaging and accessible for diverse student needs.

title: Our latest fraud and scams advisory
author: Laurie Richardson
description: An overview from Google’s Trust & Safety teams on the most recent online scam trends.
summary: Google's November 2025 advisory highlights prevalent fraud and scam tactics, underscoring its proactive use of AI and machine learning to detect and mitigate these threats across its platforms. The company emphasizes continuous efforts to protect users by identifying malicious content, phishing attempts, and fraudulent schemes, providing practical tips for online safety and security.

title: Improving Structured Outputs in the Gemini API
author: Gemini API Team
description: Today, we're announcing enhancements to Structured Outputs in the Gemini API.
summary: Google is enhancing the Gemini API with structured outputs, allowing developers to receive AI responses in predictable, parseable formats like JSON. This improvement simplifies the integration of Gemini's powerful generative AI capabilities into applications, making it easier to build reliable and robust AI-powered features for diverse use cases.

title: A new report from the Google Threat Intelligence Group shows adversaries experimenting with AI for novel capabilities.
summary: Google's Threat Intelligence Group (TIG) released a report detailing emerging AI-powered threats and the activities of state-sponsored actors leveraging AI for cyber espionage and disinformation campaigns. The report highlights new attack vectors, including the use of generative AI for sophisticated phishing and social engineering, underscoring the critical need for advanced AI-driven defenses and international collaboration to combat these evolving digital dangers.

title: Listen to the Brazilian rainforests and help contribute to AI research
author: Marconi Campos
description: Google Arts & Culture is launching a new Nature & AI experiment that invites people everywhere to listen to the sounds of the Brazilian rainforests to help monitor their biodiversity health
summary: Google Arts & Culture's "Forest Listeners" project employs AI and machine learning to analyze soundscapes from forests worldwide, aiding in biodiversity monitoring and conservation efforts. By interpreting acoustic data, the initiative helps scientists understand ecosystem health, track species, and identify threats like illegal logging, turning ambient forest sounds into valuable ecological insights.

title: Google is helping girls “scout” a path to digital wellbeing.
summary: Google.org is partnering with the Girl Scouts to launch an educational program focused on digital wellbeing, equipping young girls with essential skills for safe and responsible online engagement. This initiative aims to foster critical thinking about technology use, promote healthy digital habits, and empower the next generation to navigate the internet securely and confidently.

title: The latest AI news we announced in October
author: Keyword Team
description: Here are Google’s latest AI updates from October 2025
summary: Google's October 2025 AI updates showcase significant advancements across its product portfolio, introducing new capabilities in generative AI, multimodal understanding, and responsible AI development. These enhancements, spanning areas like search, creativity, and developer tools, underscore Google's ongoing commitment to pushing the boundaries of artificial intelligence while prioritizing safety and accessibility.

title: Meet Project Suncatcher, a research moonshot to scale machine learning compute in space.
description: Artificial intelligence is a foundational technology that could help us tackle humanity's greatest challenges. Now, we're asking where we can go next to unlock its fulle…
summary: Google's "Project Suncatcher" leverages advanced AI and machine learning to optimize renewable energy integration and enhance sustainability efforts. The initiative focuses on improving the efficiency of solar energy systems and smart grid management, contributing to Google's broader commitment to operating on 24/7 carbon-free energy.

title: Mixboard is now available in over 180 more countries.
summary: Google Labs' experimental AI music creation tool, Mixboard, is expanding its availability to over 180 additional countries and territories, making AI-powered audio generation accessible to a global audience. This expansion allows more users to experiment with generative AI for music production, enabling intuitive mixing and sound design across diverse regions.

title: New tools in Google AI Studio to explore, debug and share logs
author: Sara Wiltberger
description: We’re introducing a new logs and datasets feature in Google AI Studio.
summary: Google AI Studio is introducing enhanced features for developers, including robust support for managing logs and datasets, streamlining the process of building, testing, and refining AI models. These updates empower developers to efficiently track model performance, iterate on prompts, and curate high-quality training data, accelerating the development of sophisticated AI applications.

title: Chat in NotebookLM: A powerful, goal-focused AI research partner
author: Anuja Agrawal
description: We’re rolling out changes to NotebookLM to make it fundamentally smarter and more powerful.
summary: NotebookLM is receiving a significant upgrade with the introduction of custom personas, allowing users to tailor the AI's behavior and conversational style to better suit specific research or creative tasks. This enhancement, coupled with an underlying engine upgrade, provides a more personalized and effective AI assistant, improving the quality and relevance of generated insights.

title: Accelerating discovery with the AI for Math Initiative
author: Eugénie Rives
description: The AI for Math Initiative brings together five of the world's most prestigious research institutions.
summary: Google DeepMind is advancing AI capabilities in mathematics, demonstrating how AI can solve complex math problems, including assisting with theorem proving and generating novel mathematical conjectures. This research pushes the boundaries of AI's reasoning abilities, opening new avenues for scientific discovery and educational tools in advanced mathematics.

title: Meet the 11 startups using AI to build a safer digital future in Latin America
author: Paco Solsona
description: Learn more about the startups chosen for Google for Startups Accelerator: AI for Cybersecurity.
summary: Google for Startups has launched an "AI for Cybersecurity" cohort, providing mentorship, resources, and access to Google's expertise for promising startups focused on leveraging AI to combat cyber threats. This initiative aims to accelerate innovation in cybersecurity, helping early-stage companies develop cutting-edge solutions for a safer digital ecosystem.

title: Cybersecurity Awareness Month 2025
description: A collection of Google's latest security features and updates for Cybersecurity Awareness Month 2025.
summary: Google is actively participating in Cybersecurity Awareness Month 2025, promoting best practices and offering resources to help individuals and businesses enhance their online safety. The company highlights tools like two-step verification, password management, and AI-powered threat detection to empower users against evolving cyber threats and foster a more secure digital environment.

title: Create on-brand marketing content for your business with Pomelli
author: Bea Alessio
description: Pomelli, our newest experiment from Google Labs and DeepMind, is here to help you create on-brand marketing content.
summary: Google Labs is introducing "Pomelli," an experimental AI project designed to explore novel applications of artificial intelligence in daily tasks and creative endeavors. While specific functionalities are still emerging, Pomelli aims to provide users with intuitive AI assistance, reflecting Google's continuous innovation in developing next-generation AI tools.

title: Google Beam is working with the USO to support military families.
author: Andrew Nartker
description: Learn more about Google’s work with the USO and how it plans to launch a program that will enable service members to stay in touch with loved ones.
summary: Google Beam, an initiative by Google.org, is partnering with the USO to provide digital skill training and resources for military members, veterans, and their families. This collaboration aims to equip service members with essential technology skills for career transitions and personal development, bridging the digital divide and supporting their integration into the civilian workforce.
